title: Just a fling. PART 1
body:
I tapped my nails against the table, waiting for my chocolate milk. 

“Hey? Do you mind if I sit here?” A deep British voice asked. 

I looked up to the not so much of a stranger.

“Yeah, go ahead.” I shrugged my shoulders to look unaffected. I was surprised by the evenness my voice held. A famous superstar was sitting next to me for God’s sake. He looked even better in person, wearing a floral summer shirt and swimming shorts, he looked like he just finished with a photo shoot. But I knew that can’t be true, I mean it was 7 in the morning, but then again, I would never know.

“I am Harry, by the way.” He interrupted my train of thought. I couldn’t stop the chuckle that left my lips. Damn it, Cherry! I thought we’d agree to act as if we lived under a rock. My inner voice screamed. Well, it is what it is. 

“I know, I am Cherry.” I replied. Ain’t no use hiding it now that I knew he was  Harry styles. 

“Really? I almost thought you didn’t. I am not used to such a cool reaction.”

“I couldn’t not know you, I don’t live under a rock. Although, I wish I did.”

He was about to say something, but the waiter interrupted. 

“Your order, ma’am” 

“Thank you.” I smiled. 

“So, Bahamas, huh?” I asked. sipping on the drink. 

“No better place to enjoy summer, right?”

“Maybe. But I doubt you lack options.”

He chuckled, and that was enough to send tingles down my spine. God, he already looked dreamy. I wonder what sound he would make if I-

“True. But I am here to enjoy the summer and get some work done. I was loosing inspiration back home and mum suggested that I take ‘some well deserved vacation’ So here I am.” 

“Ah! So you are still working. Superstar life is hard, eh? But what do you mean by inspiration?” I furrowed my eyebrows. I never understood how taking a vacation could inspire someone. Whenever I needed some inspiration I would just go on pinterest and search up some motivational quotes. But that’s just me. 

“Come with me to Viola’s tonight? I’ll show you what I am talking ‘bout.” 

I sipped the last of my drink. “What time?” Was I nervous? Fuck yes! But I wasn’t going to let that affect the thing we had going on. Was there really something going on, though? I didn’t know.

“Does six sound good to you?” 

“See you there at six then.” I skipped out of the small diner. 



Hey, you gorgeous people! I have decided to try my hand at writing. So, do you think I should continue this series? This is my first time. Constructive criticism is welcome. 
Yours Truly,
Bubbles.

How, so easily, you can just pack your bags and run away – cutting your hair, changing your names. You’d send postcards home, detailing your adventures, and each night you’d find yourselves knotted beneath the sheets, and the world would never know.

You would have disappeared, gone with the wind, and the only thing they would be left with is your memory.
